skill.name: statsmodels
skill.description: Statistical modeling toolkit. OLS, GLM, logistic, ARIMA, time series, hypothesis tests, diagnostics, AIC/BIC, for rigorous statistical inference and econometric analysis.
skill.summary: Statistical modeling toolkit. OLS, GLM, logistic, ARIMA, time series, hypothesis tests, diagnostics,...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No executable code or network activity is present. Content is instructional documentation for statistical modeling. No data access or system modification patterns detected.

content.value_statement: You need reliable statistical inference and model evaluation. This skill provides stepwise guidance, diagnostics, and model selection patterns for statsmodels.
actual_capabilities: Explain OLS setup, interpretation, and diagnostics
Guide GLM family and link selection with examples
Outline discrete choice model options and evaluation
Detail time series modeling, forecasting, and validation
Describe statistical tests, assumptions, and influence checks
limitations: Does not execute models or run code
Requires Python and statsmodels installed by the user
Does not provide dataset-specific results without data
Does not replace domain expertise for causal claims

use_cases.title: Select regression type
use_cases.description: Choose OLS, GLM, or count models and confirm required diagnostics.

use_cases.title: Validate model assumptions
use_cases.description: Plan heteroskedasticity, autocorrelation, and influence checks.

use_cases.title: Build time series plan
use_cases.description: Specify ARIMA or SARIMAX workflow with evaluation steps.

prompt_templates.title: Pick a regression model
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a continuous outcome with covariates
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend the best statsmodels regression family for my outcome and explain why. List required diagnostics and key outputs to report.

prompt_templates.title: Plan GLM analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: You have count data with overdispersion
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GLM analysis plan in statsmodels for count data. Include Poisson, overdispersion check, and when to switch to Negative Binomial.

prompt_templates.title: Design discrete choice study
prompt_templates.scenario: You predict a categorical outcome with 4 classes
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a statsmodels discrete choice approach for four classes. Include model selection, marginal effects, and evaluation metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Build ARIMA workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide an ARIMA workflow in statsmodels with stationarity tests, ACF and PACF guidance, and forecast validation steps.

output_examples.input: Outline a diagnostics checklist for an OLS model
output: Confirm constant term and missing values handling
Run heteroskedasticity tests and report p-values
Inspect influence using Cook distance and leverage
Compare AIC and BIC across candidate models

best_practices: Start with simple models and add complexity based on diagnostics
Report confidence intervals and robust standard errors when needed
Validate with holdout or cross-validation before final claims
anti_patterns: Use OLS for binary or count outcomes
Compare non-nested models with likelihood ratio tests

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides platform-agnostic guidance and works in any prompt-based workflow.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It does not run code or compute results. You must supply data and execution environment.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my analysis pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, use it to plan steps and map outputs, then implement in your existing Python pipeline.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it contains documentation only and does not read files or send data.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot convergence issues?
faq.answer: Check scaling, model specification, and data quality, then review diagnostics and alternative families.

faq.question: How does it compare to general statistics guides?
faq.answer: It is tailored to statsmodels APIs, diagnostics, and workflow patterns.
